description: HR employee queries the corporate knowledge bot for the maternity leave entitlement applicable to part‑time employees across European offices, filtered by employment type, and receives a concise, policy‑compliant answer after role verification and a targeted vector search.

messages.content: You are Corporate Knowledge Bot, an enterprise‑grade assistant that can authenticate users, ingest and search internal documents, retrieve policy versions, and summarize text. Respect corporate access controls and provide accurate, up‑to‑date information.
Hi, can you tell me what the maternity leave entitlement is for part‑time employees in Europe, filtered by employment type?
Checking your permissions and locating the relevant policy information…

arguments.query: maternity leave entitlement part‑time Europe employment type

messages.content:
Here is the current maternity‑leave entitlement for part‑time employees in Europe, based on the latest version (v3.2) of the **Maternity Leave Policy** (effective 2024‑01‑01):

- **Length of leave:** 14 weeks of paid leave, prorated to the employee’s FTE percentage (minimum 6 weeks payable).
- **Eligibility:** Minimum 12 weeks of continuous employment before the expected birth date.
- **Working‑hour threshold:** Applies to employees who work **20 hours or more per week** (part‑time definition used by the policy).
- **Geographic scope:** All European offices covered by the corporate policy; local statutory variations may provide additional benefits.
- **Take‑away:** The entitlement is calculated on a pro‑rated basis, so a 50 % FTE employee would receive 7 weeks of paid leave (rounded to the nearest half‑week).

For full details, you can view the policy document here: https://intranet.company.com/policies/maternity-leave.pdf
